cluster.name: Media Playback
cluster.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling Media Playback (PLAY, PAUSE, etc) on a media device such as a TV or Speaker.

command.name: Play
command.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL play media.

command.name: Pause
command.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL pause media.

command.name: StopPlayback
command.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL stop media. User experience is context-specific. This will often navigate the user back to the location where media was originally launched.

command.name: StartOver
command.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Start Over with the current media playback item.

command.name: Previous
command.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL cause the handler to be invoked for "Previous". User experience is context-specific. This will often Go back to the previous media playback item.

command.name: Next
command.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL cause the handler to be invoked for "Next". User experience is context-specific. This will often Go forward to the next media playback item.

command.name: Rewind
command.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Rewind through media. Different Rewind speeds can be used on the TV based upon the number of sequential calls to this function. This is to avoid needing to define every speed now (multiple fast, slow motion, etc).

command.name: FastForward
command.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Advance through media. Different FF speeds can be used on the TV based upon the number of sequential calls to this function. This is to avoid needing to define every speed now (multiple fast, slow motion, etc).
